description.narrative: Complementing past IFC investments in the Konak and Karsiyaka tramways as well as the traffic management project, the proposed investment is expected to yield high development benefits by promoting railways as an efficient and environmentally-friendly mode of transportation. By supporting expanded metro ridership, the Project is expected to help reduce travel times and road network congestion, as well as contribute to higher urban productivity, economic growth and private sector development. The project will also contribute to greenhouse gas reduction of 120 tonnes per annum CO2 equivalent over the medium to long term.

The Project is an IFC A-Loan of up to EUR 20 million to support IMM to purchase 85 railcars for the Izmir Metro system. The investment will provide significant additional capacity to the Izmir Metro system to carry a growing passenger flow, contributing to the Citys ambitious plans to shift a major part of urban transport from road to rail. The railcars will complement the sea transportation, traffic management and the tramway projects recently financed by IFC and other IFIs, with the goal to reduce road congestion and promote alternative environmentally-friendly modes of public transportation in Izmir.
